entry.title: Look at me, Look at me, I Exist, I Exist
entry.summary:
Author: ciarabuckleydiaz

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 153,560Chapters: 29/43Kudos: 192

Summary: Evan knew he'd be in a group home forever. I mean, who wants a 15 year old boy who's got autism and ADHD? Nobody. That's the truth. Everyone wants a pretty, shiny baby, perhaps a young, cute toddler. Not a traumatised, desperate of love teenager. So why was he chosen? That's the question he wants to know. Maybe it was pity. Â  OR bobby and athena foster/ adopt teenage evan buckley!

entry.title: Bonus Gift In-store
entry.summary:
Author: sassay

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,933Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: Buck looks this (incredibly good-looking) stranger up and down and makes a potentially stupid decision, but well as heâ€™s been told before â€˜Buckâ€™s gotta Buckâ€™, besides worse case this guy runs off in disgust or embarrassment, absolute worst case, Buck gets punched - either way Buck takes the toy home for Hen or best case scenarioâ€¦ â€œI havenâ€™t actually purchased it yet so I can help you out, for a price,â€ Buck fixes a cocky look on his face.â€œA price? Are you seriously trying to swindle cash out of me?â€ the guy glares at Buck.â€œNot cash,â€ Buck continues, â€œA date.â€ Buck has left his Christmas shopping to the last minute, oblivious to the craziness levels that get higher in retail the closer it is to Christmas. He's been asked to see if he can find a Lazer Fightbot 3000 - the latest popular toy - as a favour. Somehow he manages to track one down, but this handsome stranger is also looking for one, to make his kid's first Christmas in LA 'the best Christmas ever'. Maybe they can negotiate some kind of deal? PROMPT 12 - LAST MINUTE GIFT SHOPPING

entry.title: should've asked you questions
entry.summary:
Author: lauriesamy

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,271Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 9

Summary: Eddie drops the hand pulling at the skin of his face and lets his eyes catch the letter again, lingering on the stance written for him. The cursive Buck haunts him, the delicate way his abuela wrote his name with Eddieâ€™s. She had prayed for him. She had prayed for him and Buck. She had wanted him to find the happiness he sought in Buckâ€”his best friend. She knew before he did. Mi niÃ±o, you were looking in the wrong place. OR: When cleaning out her house, Eddie finds a prayer his abuela left for him.

entry.title: eventually,us
entry.summary:
Author: Cami_69

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,103Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: a drunken night, after a crew dinner leads to Buck and Eddie slowly peeling away the years of unspoken tension between them. In a moment of drunken desire something intense and intimate unfolds, leaving both men vulnerable and exposed. Morning brings hangovers, clarity, and panic; especially for Eddie, who is overwhelmed by guilt, fear, and what the night might mean for his son, their friendship, and their future. While, Buck experiences the fear of losing his best friend, and not wanting to overstep and confess to his own feelings. But later on after some communication they're relationship slowly builds into something deeper than before.

entry.title: Chris Vs. Buddie
entry.summary:
Author: FoxFire17

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,665Chapters: 8/9Kudos: 36

Summary: Chris discovers LA citizens have been posting A03 Buddie Fanfics, confirming his suspicions on Buddie. He struggles with how to tell his parents about this info over the next few days, while biting his tongue on how he agrees. Finally, while the 118 is at Bobby's, Chris hosts a spontaneous intervention, much to his and the 118's relief. OR Chris silently judges Buck and Eddie until he confronts them on it. To his surprise, everyone around him agrees while Eddie and Buck have an existential crisis.

Summary: The next day Eddie opens his locker to see a small bag of gummy bears and a note.â€˜You are beary great. Enjoy this beary sweet treat.â€™ It had a little bear sticker and was signed 'Your Secret Santa'. Eddie couldnâ€™t help but smile, such an eye-rolling, dorky pun plus a surprise sugar boost. It was sweet really.â€œWhy are you smiling at your locker?â€ Ravi asks as he finishes buttoning up his shirt, Buck looks up from his position on the bench doing up his boots with an inquisitive look on his face.â€œI got a surprise from my Secret Santa,â€ Eddie replies as he shows the note and gummy bears. After attending a team relationship building workshop with other First Responder Captains, Chim has decided to run a Secret Santa for the shift as a morale boosting exercise. Eddie starts receiving cute little gifts and punny notes in his locker from his Secret Santa which brighten his day. While Chim is determined no one is allowed to let anyone know who they have for Secret Santa, Eddie is keen to get to the bottom of this puzzle. One thing Eddie is certain of, is that his Secret Santa is definitely not Buck...right? PROMPT 11 - SECRET SANTA
